data.title: Great Food and Pizza
data.text: I have eaten here several times and it has always been a pleasant experience. Their food is very good and so is their pizza. Prices are reasonable. The restaurant is very spacious and is located in a very nice area. Their service is always excellent.

data.title: The Best Pizza
data.text: We had pizza and I think is the best pizza that I've ever had. My daughter said, when we want to eat pizza this is the only place that we have to go. The service was good.  I love the pizza crust

data.title: Good food. Italian family owned friendly restaurant.
data.text: Great for Italian casual dining.  Family friendly. Good food from Pizza to calamari, from pasta fagioli to gelato.

data.title: Great Italian Food
data.text: I used to eat lunch there at least once a week. Love it. Very tasty food and friendly atmosphere. love their file salmon and the pizzas.

data.title: Outstanding Service
data.text: We enjoyed our dining experience here. The customer service was outstanding. The food was good. Honestly, I've had better lasagna, but it was still good. I recommend at least giving LaFamiglia a try!

data.title: Best Italian Secret
data.text: Italian food is my favorite and chicken piccata and chicken Francaise are my main meals of choice.  Chef Luigi prepares the tastiest chicken Francaise and piccata  I have ever tasted, juicy and browned to perfection.  I have eaten at Italian restaurants in New York, and all over and this is the best.  The pizza crust is perfect.  My husband said it had a little too much cheese but that is a personal preference and I'm sure if he asked, they would put less cheese.  The salad is always fresh and the creamy Italian dressing is very tasty.  We have eaten here many times with family and friends and they all love the food.  The servers are all young but very mature and friendly.  Mike was our server last night and he was a pleasure.  You must try this place and give it a chance, you will be pleasantly surprised and pleased.

data.title: Excellent Pasta and Pizza!!!
data.text: A definite hometown favorite.  The pasta is always delicious and the pizza is also very, very good.  The garlic rolls are superb.  The restaurant is nicely decorated and has a very nice atmosphere.  However, it's always really cold inside so if you get cold easily, bring a light sweater.  Service is usually very good, but when the restaurant is full, they tend to overlook some tables.  Nonetheless, it's always a nice experience.

data.title: Great Italian food!
data.text: Real good Italian food with great service. We have been here 4 times and each time the food and service is amazing. I do not know where the people are coming from that give this place bad reviews. It seems to be good when we visit. The Veal parmegian was excellent and so was the Eggplant parmegian. Our waiter was great and the service was also great. We will definitely be stopping by again.

data.title: Really Dissapointed CANNOT Recommend
data.text:
As I have said many times, see Where the reviews are from, and See What Level and Experience the reviewer has.

Good - Location, It is across from the Miramar City Hall so it is in a safe area very nice modern center, Building - Plenty of space nice tables well lite. Salad my Wife was served the greens were fresh, however the tomatoes on the salad could not be eaten they were almost green. Service - The young lady who served us gave us professional service and was friendly.

BAD ! - Well where do I start...  I ordered the Garlic Rolls, AWFUL, the actual rolls were good quality and hot, but... the garlic they put on top of it was store bought minced jar garlic and it was RANCID !   My Wife's Pasta Fagiol Soup was watery, hardly any pasta in it and virtually tasteless, she had to put parmesan cheese and red pepper in it to eat it. My Eggplant Parmegian had issues. First I had never ever seen a sauce like this it was orange and not much taste to it. The amount of eggplant was razor thin and breaded heavily. I thought it was "fair at best", my Wife tried it and said it tasted Bad to her. I ate anyway and paid the price for it later, I got a bad case of Colic !  Also, I asked if they had "San Pellegrino flavored sparkling waters", the reply was NO !   No flavored Pellegrino in an Italian restaurant ? Bottom Line, find someplace else to go eat, but not here. Also it is expensive.

data.title: Have you actually had real Italian cuisine?
data.text: I agree with Sherry, the food is ok. I don't think the food here is as good as people say, the order of mozzarella sticks was probably the best thing there. We had a Shrimp scampi, and a Backed ziti. To  start things off the salad was a small bowl with lettuce a slice of tomato and some olives. The shrimp scampi was "sour" at most, the shrimp were very over cooked and way to chewy to eat it was pasta. (The shrimp scampi was sent back) The baked ziti sauce was watery and not enough cheese. The food is cheap I will give it that, but it is nothing special for dinner.

data.title: Dinner isn't worth it
data.text: I really do not understand why these people give this place a good review.  We went for dinner.  We will not be going back.  Firsy, the salad is minimal at best.  They do not even have creamy italian dressing!  The eggplant wasn't good, and the Meatballs were sent back.  We asked our server if they were large.  He said yes. Nope.  They were small and bready.  Not good.  We switched to pizza.   The server said they had a thick crust pizza.   Nope.  It was thin like a tortilla.  The sauce was more Mexican Style than Italian.  Big turnoff.  They are really a pizza place for Spanish people.  If you are local,  then travel the extra 5 minutes to Pines Blvd and go to Olive Garden!   Even though it's a chain, it's actually much better than this place!

data.title: Best Italian Food in Hollywood Fl area!!!!
data.text: We are from the Philadelphia area.  Became Snowbirds 3 yrs ago....Always go to Umbertos.....well we were introduced to La Familia.......we went there for the very first time and have been back every Sunday for the last 4 weeks!  Unheard of for my husband! LOL! He always gets the Fra Diavolo and I always get the Shrimp Parmejan! To die for! And yes, we are Italian.....Oh and don't forget to sample the Tiramasu!  We took my daughter there, for all three meals (she got the same as my husband) which includes salad, garlic rolls + we ordered a bottle of chardonnay..+ dessert  .$75

data.title: Well located and large portions
data.text: The restaurant is across from the Miramar cultural center. The staff is friendly and helpful, the food is excellent and the portions are plentiful.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: I've ordered pizza from La Famiglia two times and both times it was very good.  This is New York style pizza with a thing homemade crust.  The crust has a smokey flavor and is cut in big slices.  Two slices from a large pizza and I'm full.  They use fresh mozzarella cheese and a flavorful sauce.  I had a pepperoni pizza and a meatball/mushroom pizza.  The ingredients do not cover the entire pizza, which I prefer since the taste is better balanced.

data.title: first good experience
data.text: we were visiting family and on the way we saw the restaurant. We ordered pizza and calzone. both were delicious and the serve was excellent as well.

data.title: The view was good....
data.text:
The view was great but food was average. It was expensive and the food was okay. The waitress was very nice though, she was very pleasant and friendly. 
If you have kids with you, note the kids menu portions are too big. We got the cheese pizza which was so big.

data.title: Top shelf food in casual atmosphere
data.text: After reading the reviews, thought I'd try it out on my first night of a business trip, and glad I did. Friendly staff and she sure sounded Italian when I asked about the menu! Fresh salad, cold beer, and very good pasta, what more can you ask for? Good prices? They've got you covered there, too.

data.title: Everything is fresh,, I mean everything..
data.text: This place I would say is one of the top notch Italian Restaurant in The Pines/ Miramar area..  I noticed straight from the start that the food was fresh starting from the salad... all the way to the main dish... I ask the manager his tastiness of freshness outshine other restaurants... His answer was " We don't have a freezer here, so we never freeze the food"...  Well that explains a lot... Food fantastic reasonable prices ... Too early to become my favorite Italian Rest... But I see it coming..

data.title: The best
data.text: Was their with friends. Loved the food and the service . Had risotto with mushrooms it was awesome. My friend had pizza and they thought it was the best they ever had . Will be back with more friends.

data.title: Great neighborhood restaurant with outstanding food
data.text:
This is one of the best Italian restaurants in the area. The place is very laid back and not over the top, two good qualities I look for when dining at a place that prides itself in selling authentic Italian food.

The menu has plenty of choices, and pretty much all of the dishes I have had have been really good. The pizza is huge and delicious, you can really tell the sauce is prepared fresh in the restaurant using high quality ingredients. Furthermore, it is a really great value for what you get.

My favorite, however, has to be the pasta, especially the penne arrabiatta. Penne arrabiatta has to be my favorite pasta dish of all time, and it is one that is not so easily found in US restaurants, especially one that it is well prepared. It is for that reason that I was pretty pleased when I saw the restaurant offered it, and even more when I tried it and realized it was one of the better ones I have had in the country. It has the right amount of spice and the consistency is more crushed tomatoes than an actual sauce, just as it should be.

I come to this restaurant pretty often, and would recommend it to anyone that is interested in getting a less American version of Italian food.
